61e823a5-5d67-4202-821a-5f1bf718b1e4.description: This badge, issued by the CU System Office of Academic Affairs, recognizes the sustained efforts of members of the Open CU Steering Team. Members have written and managed grants (including faculty stipends), created and taught multiple instructor workshops, presented at local and national conferences, and engaged in monthly strategic and logistical discussions to use a collective impact approach to increase the use of OER across CU's four campuses.
61e823a5-5d67-4202-821a-5f1bf718b1e4.name: OER Steering Team Badge

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado System

badge_template_activities.title: The recipient of this badge will have successfully assisted in the writing of OER grants, managed campus OER grant funds, designed and implemented educator workshops, presented on OER at one or more conferences or workshops, advocated for OER with campus leadership, engaged in bi-monthly Open CU Steering Team meetings, and used a collective impact approach to further OER on CU's campuses.

d90219fe-ce3e-4a09-a2b6-bf4857ce538c.description: This badge, issued by the CU System Office of Academic Affairs, with input from the Open CU Team recognizes leadership and innovation in the area of open educational resources. Nominated by colleagues, recipients have contributed to the open education movement by either adopting or creating OER, increasing campus and/or system awareness of OER, and/or galvanizing interest in exploring, adopting, and creating OER or open access to benefit the University of Colorado's students and beyond in 2022.
d90219fe-ce3e-4a09-a2b6-bf4857ce538c.name: OER 2022 Champion Nominee Badge

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado System

badge_template_activities.title: The recipient of this badge has been nominated by colleagues and has successfully integrated OER into one or more courses and their OER work had a positive impact on students.

d73424ba-6043-4b2c-a0a0-9deda51fb0ba.description: The Open CU Team and the Office of Academic Affairs at the CU System selected one CU OER Champion for each campus in 2021. The award celebrates four University of Colorado educators who contribute to the open education movement, increase campus and system awareness of OER, and/or galvanize interest in exploring, adopting, and creating OER to benefit the University of Colorado's students and beyond.
d73424ba-6043-4b2c-a0a0-9deda51fb0ba.name: OER Champion Badge

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado System

badge_template_activities.title: The recipient of this badge was nominated by colleagues and chosen as a top representative for the campus.  They will have successfully integrated OER into one or more courses, their OER work will have had a positive impact on students, their OER contributions follow accessibility guidelines, they've demonstrated leadership in and broad advocacy for open education, creativity and innovation in the use of OER, sustained engagement with OER, and advocated broadly for open education and OER.

79e992d4-54c4-4963-b43b-268d90b54f5e.description: The Kempe Center was the first of its kind, established in 1972 to better understand and prevent child maltreatment and to serve affected children and their families. For the past 50 years, Kempe has promoted understanding, knowledge, and best practices to prevent and treat child abuse and neglect globally. Under the Kempe Microcredentials program, this badge will issue to the learners who complete the Kempe professional training in justice, equity, diversity & inclusion (JEDI).
79e992d4-54c4-4963-b43b-268d90b54f5e.name: Kempe JEDI Badge

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado System

alignments.name: Badge Issuing
alignments.description: After you complete all the JEDI learning criteria and requirements, click on the link above to earn your Kempe JEDI badge.

badge_template_activities.title: Join our partner at the Kempe Foundation on Facebook Live! Celebrate the Black History Month and listen to the interview with Kempe JEDI Director, Michelle Davis, to discuss Kempe’s JEDI initiatives and some of the longer-term goals.
Participate the Critical Race Theory Training with Dr. Nicholas Grier and team (Virtual) on 3/16 from 8 am - 3 pm.
Apply your JEDI learning with one of the Kempe JEDI Affinity groups at the Kempe retreat in April, and submit your reflection paper after the event.

skills.name: Child Abuse Prevention And Treatment Act

3a391852-3fea-4b46-a5b4-003e3273121d.description: MOOCs (Massive Open Online Courses) are open-access, non-credit classes offered through FutureLearn and available at no cost to participants (or at low cost for those seeking certificates of completion). The University of Colorado is one of FutureLearn's institutional partners and provides content in the form of courses and specializations. Faculty and staff on all CU campuses make this open learning possible by taking on intensive instructional courses in addition to their existing work.
3a391852-3fea-4b46-a5b4-003e3273121d.name: MOOC FutureLearn Course Creator

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado System

badge_template_activities.title: The recipient of this badge created and launched one or more courses on the FutureLearn platform. The Office of Digital Education and Engagement at the University of Colorado System verifies the recipient's creation and launch of course content through its campus liaisons and the FutureLearn platform.

a22194c9-a6bb-4144-815e-eac9444ff4f1.description: MOOCs (Massive Open Online Courses) are open-access, non-credit classes offered through various platforms and available at no cost to participants (or at low cost for those seeking certificates of completion). The University of Colorado provides content in the form of courses and specializations in support of MOOCs. Faculty and staff on all CU campuses make this open learning possible by taking on intensive instructional courses in addition to their existing work.
a22194c9-a6bb-4144-815e-eac9444ff4f1.name: MOOC Production

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado System

badge_template_activities.title: The recipient of this badge supported the creation and launch of one or more courses or specializations on the MOOC platforms by providing video production, facilitation, and/or other development support. The Office of Digital Education and Engagement at the University of Colorado System verifies the recipient's development support of content through its campus liaisons and the MOOC platform.

a4e9578d-a876-47ef-86c7-e81b95e2ab8f.description: MOOCs (Massive Open Online Courses) are open-access, non-credit classes offered through Coursera and available at no cost to participants (or at low cost for those seeking certificates of completion). The University of Colorado is one of Coursera's leading institutional partners and provides content in the form of courses and specializations. Faculty and staff on all CU campuses make this open learning possible by taking on intensive instructional courses in addition to their existing work.
a4e9578d-a876-47ef-86c7-e81b95e2ab8f.name: MOOC Coursera Course Creator

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado System

badge_template_activities.title: The recipient of this badge created and launched one or more courses on the Coursera platform. 9cc58938-59ff-4fb1-ab85-add8519a02ed.description: MOOCs (Massive Open Online Courses) are open-access, non-credit classes offered through various platforms and available at no cost to participants (or at low cost for those seeking certificates of completion). The University of Colorado provides content in the form of courses and specializations in support of MOOCs. Faculty and staff on all CU campuses make this open learning possible by taking on intensive instructional courses in addition to their existing work.
